topics.author: 4fdef063945b700a9d01604f

topics.body: I think another problem with my arting attempts is that I've mostly been attempting to mimic other art styles. (I should probably come up with my style first before I try imitation.)
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/556edd286368724cacd41d00#post_556edd286368724cacd41d00
Actually mimicking others isn't a bad way to start from what I've heard 
Although most art books I've read say to start from realism and work your way down to stylization. The phrase I've heard used was something along the lines of "learning the rules so you know which ones to break"
^~which may be true but it sounds like a pain in the anus~^
topics.author: 500b587e7f123b1f230014a9

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/556ede816368724cac352000#post_556ede816368724cac352000
I think the problem is that I usually target professional art for my sketch attempts.
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/556ede816368724cac352000#post_556ede816368724cac352000
That just put something in my mind.
Rules are made to be broken.
topics.author: 5446fcfc6368723ec21a0000

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/556edd286368724cacd41d00#post_556edd286368724cacd41d00
imitation is better first because it helps give you a sense at what youre good with and what you arent good at. it can also help influence your own style
topics.author: 4ffbfff37f123b072a01bb5b

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/556ede816368724cac352000#post_556ede816368724cac352000
the whole "realism down to stylization" thing will only work if you already have a sensibility for art, i could probably do that considering how ive been doing art for years, but somebody who has a lack of sensibility would find that to be way too difficult
topics.author: 4ffbfff37f123b072a01bb5b

Although I guess it doesn't hurt to try mimicking a less experienced artist

topics.body:
"@MoogSourceVermona":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/556ee09d6368726da48b0000#post_556ee09d6368726da48b0000
I'm not entirely sure what you mean? Although going from scratch to realism does sound a lot like climbing Everest equipped with a fork and a Christmas sweater
topics.author: 500b587e7f123b1f230014a9

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/556ee123636872614b1c0d00#post_556ee123636872614b1c0d00
what i mean by having a "sensibility in art" is to have an understanding in basic techniques and how each tool in art works and functions with individual techniques, also just having general basic art skills.
